meanings.definition: A thing that protrudes from something else.
meanings.sent1: The tree had a small protuberance on its trunk.
meanings.sent2: I noticed a protuberance on the rock jutting out.
meanings.sent3: The protuberance on the balloon made it look like a tiny bump.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was a protuberance in the calm atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The protuberance on the turtle's shell was a distinctive feature.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being protuberant.
meanings.sent1: The protuberance of the hill made it stand out in the landscape.
meanings.sent2: His belly's protuberance was noticeable in his tight shirt.
meanings.sent3: The protuberance of the cake made it seem like a delicious mountain.
meanings.sent4: The protuberance of her laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The protuberance of the flower petals added beauty to the garden.
